Extracted Text: AC HELVETAS  SRI LANKA  Terms of Reference (TOR) Design of Handbooks to support youth capacity-building programs on essential entrepreneurship skills  1. Overview HELVETAS Swiss Intercooperation is an independent development organization having its Country Office in Colombo, Sri Lanka and supporting many Projects and Partner Organizations in the Country committing to a just world in which all men and women determine the course of their lives in dignity and security, using environmental resources in a sustainable manner.  HELVETAS is entrusted with the implementation of the Project: Empowering Youth-led initiatives in Preventing Violent Extremism in Sri Lanka (EMPOWER). This project aims to enhance the resilience and capacity on Prevention of Violent Extremism (PVE) of youth from diverse ethnic, religious, cultural, and social backgrounds. A key area that the EMPOWER project focuses on is the engagement of most vulnerable youth to address their vulnerability / risk of radicalization towards violent extremism due to the lack of economic or livelihood opportunities. By addressing this issue through avenues, guidance for improved livelihoods and employment skills, these targeted youth would have sources of income and as a result be less vulnerable to violent extremism agendas and ideologies.  For this purpose, EMPOWER project implements subgrants projects in Kalutara, Kandy, and Ampara districts to provide improved livelihood and employability skills for youth at risk of recruitment in VE groups or radicalisation to engage in sustainable income generation activities and thereby avoid risk of radicalization.  HELVETAS is seeking the expertise of agencies/consultants to develop three practical handbooks on essential entrepreneurship skills, covering business creativity and innovation, business expansion through integration with existing value chains, business registration & financial Literacy for MSMEs, and ethical business practices.  2. Objectives The primary objectives of this consultancy are to: 1. Develop three practical handbooks covering key entrepreneurial skills ~  + Essential Entrepreneurship Skills, business creativity and innovation + Business expansion through integration with existing value chains + Business registration, financial literacy for MSMEs, and ethical business practices  2. Develop materials that are user-friendly, accessible, and tailored to the needs of MSMEs in Sri Lanka, incorporating real-world examples, case studies, and actionable strategies  3. Develop engaging and interactive learning materials to provide young entrepreneurs with practical, actionable knowledge and tools to start, grow, and sustain their businesses.  4, Equip MSMEs with essential knowledge and skills to enhance their business resilience, financial sustainability, and ethical operations. Visual aids, exercises, and practical tools that enhance the learning experience for MSME entrepreneurs should be Ensure the handbooks are professionally formatted, well-structured, and ready for dissemination in print and digital formats.  Essential Entrepreneurship Skills 3. Scope of Work  The consultant will be responsible for developing the following three Hand Books Handbook 1: Essential Entrepreneurship Skills & Business Creativity and Innovation  * Introduction to entrepreneurship and its importance  + Essential entrepreneurial skills such as leadership, problem-solving, and adaptability.  + Creativity and innovation in business, including idea generation and validation  * Business model development and develop a value proposition  * Marketing, customer engagement, and leveraging technology for business growth.  + Overcoming challenges and sustaining innovation in business.  Handbook 2: Business Expansion through Integration with Existing Value Chains  Understanding Value Chains Assessing Your Business for Value Chain Integration Building Strategic Partnerships  Enhancing Product/Service Quality and Standards Market Access and Competitive Positioning Exploring e-commerce and online platforms Leveraging technology for business growth Sustaining Growth and Innovation  Handbook 3: Business registration, Financial Literacy for MSMEs, and Ethical Business Practices  Business Registration and Legal Formalities Financial Literacy for Entrepreneurs Budgeting and Financial Planning Record-keeping and accounting principles Sustaining a Financially Healthy Business Managing cash flow and inventory  Cost Management  Financial analysis and performance tracking  Risk management and mitigation + Ethical Business Practices  4. Deliverables  4.1 Inception Report: + Includes a detailed work plan, methodology, and outline of each manual. + Submission after initial discussions with the project team. 4.2 Desk Review and Needs Assessment +  Areview of existing resources and stakeholder consultation to tailor content to the target audience 43 Draft Manuals + Manual 1: Essential Entrepreneurship Skills & Business Creativity and Innovation. + Manual 2: Business Expansion through Integration with Existing Value Chains. + Manual 3: Business Registration, Financial Literacy for MSMEs. 4.4 Feedback Meeting: + Feedback meeting with Project Team of Helvetas 4.5 Final Manuals + High-quality, user-friendly manuals in digital and print-ready formats in English language + Separate versions in relevant local languages if required  5. Timeline:  The consultancy is expected to be completed within eight weeks from the date of signing the contract. The tentative schedule is as follows:  Kickoff meeting, submission of the inception report, and approval of work Week 1-2 plan.  Desk review, stakeholder consulfations, and content development for the Week 3-5: first draft of manuals.  ‘Submission of draft manuals and getting feedback from Helvetas Week 6 Incorporation of feedback and refinement of content. Week7 ‘Submission of final manual Week 8  6. Qualifications of the Consultant Required Qualifications  + Proven experience in developing training materials and manuals, particularly in the field of entrepreneurship and Social business development.  + Strong understanding of business principles, financial management, and market dynamics  + Excellent writing, editing, and presentation skills.  + Experience in working with youth and/or marginalized communities in the development sector  7. Application Process  Interested consultants are invited to submit the following * Cover letter detailing relevant experience and approach + A proposal outlining the methodology, work plan, and budget. * Detailed CVs of consulting team members + Samples of similar work.  Proposed work plan and timeline  8. Evaluation Criteria The selection of the consultant(s) will be based on the following criteria  Criteria Weight (%)  Quality of the content of manuals 30% (relevancy content, clarity, design, and user-friendliness)  Relevant Experience and Expertise organization 20%  Financial Proposal 30%  Expertise in resource panel 10%  Timeline and work plan’ 10%  10. Intellectual Property Rights All materials, content, and outputs developed under this consultancy, including but not limited to the handbooks, research findings, graphics/designs and tools, shall be the exclusive property of HELVETAS. The consultant/agency shall have no rights to use, reproduce, or distribute these materials without prior written consent from HELVETAS. Any pre-existing intellectual property used in the development of the handbooks must be clearly identified, and necessary permissions or licenses obtained  9. "Designing Business Handbooks on Essential Entrepreneurship Skills ”  Email: hsisllogistics@amail.com 10.
